website_summaries.verdict: The Merrell Bare Access Flex is an attractive shoe that has excelled in the criteria of comfort and support. Some runners thought poorly of its durability, while others praised the shoe’s versatility amidst different running conditions. Given its performance on the road, the Bare Access Flex is a good option for runners who are looking for an affordable and reliable neutral shoe.
pros: The Bare Access Flex was an excellent choice for running on mixed trails because of its relaxed fit and sleek construction, according to a reviewer
Many runners praised the outsole’s performance in wet environments
Several users noted that the shoe was lightweight and was very comfortable to use on short-distance runs
The midsole was quite responsive and delivered a lot of feedback, stated a tester
There were some who thought that the toe box was nicely shaped
not too wide but also not restrictive
The shoe fared well on the technical trails even without a sock, a user wrote
cons: A reviewer mentioned that this running shoe did not perform well on tempo runs
The fabric of the upper has worn out after a brief time, a lot of users observed
Few runners commented that the Bare Access Flex offered less support compared to its predecessor
Some consumers observed squeaking sounds while walking and running in the shoe
A couple of buyers said the arch support was a little too aggressive for a neutral shoe

customer_reviews.title: The colour is awesome! I went half a size up as Merrell ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoes have just arrived - sooner than anticipated - and put them on straight away. These pair are very high quality finish. Lighter than I thought. The colour is awesome! I went half a size up as Merrell shoes tend to be on the small side. They are a perfect fit and very comfy. I will update my review once I have completed a few runs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic and small
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are much smaller than marked so had to return them, but getting the refund turns out to be a problem. The recorded delivery shows it has been delivered to the post office branch for weeks but hey claim they did not collect it. And overall - a cheap plastic (literally) - maybe ok for summer, maybe for one month. .
customer_reviews.author: Uniten Ltd

customer_reviews.title: Merrell running shoe zero drop
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoes. Different running technic. Socks are recommended for at least 4 sessions of 45mns. Insol can be rough for some beginners. Not good for rough terrain. Really good fit at the rear and wide front allow freedom of your toes. Recommended if you want to experience a new running approach.
customer_reviews.author: Gras

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort here
customer_reviews.text: In usual Merrell fashion. Great comfort here. However, be careful with the sizing especially if you plan to wear these with socks. I'd recommend a full size up.
customer_reviews.author: MacLink

customer_reviews.title: Love these trainers!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing trainer for functional training and weightlifting. . Ordered a second pair (I go through a LOT of trainers in my job- and these are fab!)
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Merrell quality
customer_reviews.text: Used for walking. A little too light but otherwise OK
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight trainer and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a present . Great lightweight trainer and very comfortable, I have been told.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn C.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Really poor quality. For almost 3 months they are falling apart.. Walked with them only in the city.
customer_reviews.author: Radoslav Karaangov

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Started squeaking loudly after one week of low intensity use.
customer_reviews.author: ldbz

customer_reviews.title: Great design, poor materials.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved these shoes, although the upper is made from some sort of awful cheap non-woven fabric and they literally fell apart after one 20 mile run on firm trails. Gutted.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is just right- nice and light
customer_reviews.text: I have been running in 'minimal' shoes for a few years and was looking for something just a bit more substantial for stepping up to marathon distance. I still wanted a light shoe with zero drop so that it wouldn't affect my technique or slow me down. This shoe is just right- nice and light, flat and fast. The sole is at home on road or light trail. Good price too.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny

customer_reviews.title: Very thin material
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a little while ago and only really use them when cycling to work. However, after a weeks the material started to tear apart on both sides of the shoes. It's due to the material being way too thin. I have always bought Merrell shoes and never had an issue as they are normally very well built and last for ages. But i have been so disappointed with these shoes. They are quite expensive and have lasted no time at all. I haven't even used them for running and they still began to tear. Very poor quality by Merrell on this occasion unfortunately,
customer_reviews.author: Shigaru

customer_reviews.title: Abysmal quality
customer_reviews.text: The look is great and the shoe was light. Unfortunately the fabric on the outside of the shoes dissintegrating after a mere 2 weeks just like in another reviewers photographs. Between this and my previous other merrel barefoot purchase which was also returned, that time because the sole started coming away, I've lost all faith in the brand and will not be wasting my time or money on them again. Thank goodness for amazon customer support to back you when buying a duff item like this shoe. Just buy some vivos and save yourself the bother!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and very comfortable and not too hot when walking which is a problem for me with all trainers, have only worn them a couple of times. Material is very thin so time will tell if it lasts. Good price too. UPDATE have worn these for over 6 months and they are starting to come apart just like other reviewer's have stated . What a pity because these are so comfy for walking and running. Why cant they make them stronger . I got these for €30 approx so the current price of £72 is ridiculous . great shoe but don't last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had sent them back
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - inexpensive - reasonably water and sand tight - lightweight - warm Cons: - uncomfortably high inner mid-sole "support" (feels like a stone under feet!), but that wears down after a while. NOT barefeet at all. - elastic laces, way too easy to overtighten, caused severe pain afterwards - relatively hard to flex sole, compared to Merrell Crusher - inexpensive materials (they tore away at the corners after a while) - too warm for anything high intensity Conclusion: I only use them though dirt and sand to spare other shoes. At times the tight lace turns them into a torture device. I'm looking forward to when I'll throw them into the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M

customer_reviews.title: These are the first pair of Merrell I returned without ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the first pair of Merrell I returned without replacement. The quality is not of Merrell's usual standard. I was expecting something similar to Vivobarefoot but these are not it. The sizing as usual for Merrell are slightly tight, but I normally get them the next size up. In this case however the problem is more with their width, too narrow, they're made for long very narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Chiappella

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of trainers
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for nearly a year now, so feel it's as good a time as any to give them an honest review. First off they've survived a year which doesn't seem like long but in that time I've ran upwards of 1200km, they've survived Tough Mudder, running in the sea, sand, mud, tracks, roads and even treadmills. The only thing that's starting to give now is the joint between the sole and upper where your toes flex, other than that they've held up really well and I will definitely be getting another pair.
customer_reviews.author: David Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Tears easily
customer_reviews.text: I have several Merrell shoes, I have always been happy with the products I've purchased from Merrell. I thought I would buy a some training shoes from Merrell for running. They look smart and are lightweight, that said after a couple of months I noticed small tears appearing in the attached pictures. After 6 months of use, the tears have just got bigger and bigger. To say I'm disappointed is an understatement. Merrell your smart/casual shoes are great but these training shoes aren't the best.
customer_reviews.author: MR DONNIE HARRIS

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the photo, and from other reviews, these trainers are prone to splitting. At time of writing I have had these trainers for just under three months. I wear them every day for work, but not for running. Very poor quality, very disappointing from Merrell. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Simon_71

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, just slightly large in the toe box
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, just slightly large in the toe box, although its also quite nice having space in the hot weather. Snug fit otherwise and doesnt feel like they will fall off ever, very grippy even on wet surfaces. Would buy again when these ware out.
customer_reviews.author: SlyScotty

customer_reviews.title: Would have been great but spoiled by raised arches
customer_reviews.text: They are thin, flexible, lightweight and appear well made and there is plenty of room for your toes to spread out. Unfortunately the sole of the shoe isn't flat - it has a raised arch that I could always feel pressing on the sole of my foot. I didn't want any kind of support in a minimalist trainer so I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: There not reliable as I only owned them for 2month and falling to peaces. Photo are off the pair. I brought these in may 2018
customer_reviews.author: Bradsleyzinho

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. There are better barefoot shoes
customer_reviews.text: I owned a pair of these in a previous model. The quality has come down. The outside material used to be supported by plastic webbing but that’s gone so now it’s just material meaning that they crease and bunch. I have thin feet and the old ones were perfect. These are much less so. They move a lot and are more likely to blister my feet. That said they are still light and flexible.
customer_reviews.author: silver.birch303

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS SHOES
customer_reviews.text: Like many others I too have developed the tearing of fabric on both sides of each shoe. AND THIS HAPPENED WITH BOTH PAIRS THAT I HAVE PURCHASED. I ordered a second pair before these issues developed, which was approx. 1 month in to wearing them for work - I did not run in these! It is a shame because they are very, very comfortable :(
customer_reviews.author: Fear Factory

customer_reviews.title: Light and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Read all feedback but have always worn Merrill so took the plunge and glad I did. So light and comfortable and too Merrells usual standards....superb value and quality
customer_reviews.author: Mr DS

customer_reviews.title: Odd fit
customer_reviews.text: These have a very strange fit. You need to have rabbit toes but ballerina ankles. I consider myself to have normal sized feet but these were strange. Narrow at the back and wide at the front.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Papa

customer_reviews.title: Terrible build quality - Fell apart.
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous model for over a year and loved them, as others have noted the build quality on these is awful. The upper is falling apart after ~10 runs and can longer be worn. Have recommended Marrell to people in the past, won't be doing so in the future.
customer_reviews.author: sbr

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise fine but this squeak is a major irritation
customer_reviews.text: They have developed a nasty squeak after a couple of months of use. Otherwise fine but this squeak is a major irritation.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes but not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Go about half a size up for these. I am 10.5 in vapour gloves, and went 11 for these. Had to return as the outsole started coming away after two runs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The fit was just right but for a "Bare" access ...
customer_reviews.text: The fit was just right but for a "Bare" access shoe it had an uncomfortably high and rigid arch support so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: vern

customer_reviews.title: Flexible, comfortable, excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, comfortable and just enough cushioning to protect without negatively affecting feel underfoot. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking lightweight shoe but they gave me extremely painful plantar fasciitis for an entire year, maybe they did me a favour as it forced me to revisit my love of cycling. They also split after about 10 runs.
customer_reviews.author: Soleman

customer_reviews.title: Great summer and workout shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really high quality shoes that are good for summer and workouts. The fabric is breath through so you're not getting too sweaty
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Really Good
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable and durable. Picked the lime green colour as they were the cheapest. Overall a good trail shoe
customer_reviews.author: Jevvy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. The shoe got holes (on the fabric) after only one month of wearing them. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M. Vrettas

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting, but...
customer_reviews.text: I’m a size 11, and my shoes fit as expected. These are extremely comfortable BUT both sets (original and replacement) developed a squeak in both shoes as I walked, sounding like I’d just walked inside after it’s rained. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Funex

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but uncomfortable 😩
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrell shoes as they’re normally really comfortable and supportive. However these trainers looked great but were uncomfortable. The instep on the left foot dug in so I had to send them back. Most likely a factory error but I couldn’t walk in them.
customer_reviews.author: F. P. Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: Cracking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this show for longer distances, my 2nd pair on the bare access range and knew the fit was good straight off the bat. Ordered on the Wednesday, delivered Thursday, Marathon on the Sunday and did a superb job!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Jardine

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy merrell bear access
customer_reviews.text: Look good fit well but they squeak when you walk. It’s quiet loud. People comment on the strange noise coming from the shoes. I have six pairs of various merrell shoes and they are amazing. The bare access are rubbish. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: G J Jones

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Same as other buyers, split at the flex point in the toe box after about 2-3 months of mild use (under 100km total running). Very poor build. Squeaky when you walk. High arch for a minimal shoe. Regret purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: great fitting
customer_reviews.text: like the room in the toebox.use these for 5k running
customer_reviews.author: william mcaulay

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight and stylish with Merrell quality. Only ...
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and stylish with Merrell quality. Only down sides are the fabric looks dark grey rather than black in the daylight and it is a larger English size 11 so I have some room to grow!
customer_reviews.author: kerry dane pitman

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Terribly terrible quality so I just returned it for a refund....
customer_reviews.author: OLUWASEUN MICHAEL ADESANYA

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these before and worn them all the time. VERY comfortable and a great fit. Second purchase only due to my old pair wearing out with so much use.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe... for the first 2 months only
customer_reviews.text: Was initially very happy with this shoe (style, comfort etc) but after just under 2 months of wearing them the upper is starting to split where the toe bends - very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: jjl

customer_reviews.title: Feel good to wear everyday
customer_reviews.text: A good light shoe to wear as everyday footwear as well as running. I feel some pressure on my instep but that's probably from over pronation, something to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Torn after 4 days of hiking
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, very comfortable, but extremely fragile. I've torn them after about 4 days of hiking. The previous model (Bare Access 4 GTX) lasted more than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great. Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Great. Good fit, good quality. I've bought several versions of the bare access, and this new one seems like the best yet
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. J. Altman

customer_reviews.title: Load of rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 10 days before holes appeared in the material. Had a replacement pair and did the same... Only thin they are good for now is painting in...!
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly, one thing to be said for Merrell ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly, one thing to be said for Merrell shoes! However started to show signs of falling apart after just running on grass in the first week. Not what you want for a light trail shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Sensei Crap

customer_reviews.title: Good, light weight
customer_reviews.text: Found them excellent from the first wear. I would recommend them to anyone, but especially if you have wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Iain

customer_reviews.title: Nice while they last
customer_reviews.text: Good: Very comfortable, look stylish Bad: material started to come apart after 6 months. Merrell should last longer
customer_reviews.author: David N Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Initially bought a 10 but sent back to change to 9.5. Replacement sent very quickly with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good minimalist trainers. Have bought other Merrell bare access and these are just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Fearless

customer_reviews.title: Good sole n traction
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes light and comfy. Draw back being not great at waterproofing. Other than that great training shoes
customer_reviews.author: gurkhayung

customer_reviews.title: A bit more cushioning would be nice..
customer_reviews.text: Yep all ok.. A bit more cushioning would be nice ... but still 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: They broke after 6 months. Extremely comfortable and good looking, but the fact that they lasted for less than a year makes me rate them with 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pilar

customer_reviews.title: The grip was dirty and full of grit and the inside of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Used product. Someone had already worn the shoes outside. The grip was dirty and full of grit and the inside of the shor had grass seeds...
customer_reviews.author: Whatever

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It may be my feet, but whilst the right shoe fits, the left one is hurting at the back
customer_reviews.author: Ladislav V Suchopar

customer_reviews.title: Durability problems let them down
customer_reviews.text: Great comfortable shoe, but similar durability problems with upper mesh disintegrating in the creases on the side after a few months of wear. Such a shame as really comfortable to run in.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Iain Mcilwee

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Bare Access Flex Fitness Shoes
product_meta.description: These Bare Access Flex shoes from Merrell feature mesh and tpu upper, traditional lace closure along with breathable mesh lining. Hyper lock printed tpu heel counter for security during quick descents and sharp turns. Flex connect dual directional flex-groove eva midsole for agility and stability on uneven terrain. M select™ grip+ outsole with anatomical grooves is sticky and durable for superior grip and traction on wet or dry trails.
feature_bullets: Breathable Mesh Upper - Allows air to permeate the upper providing a constant supply of fresh air.
FlexConnect - Resembles and supports the ligaments and tendons in the human foot.
Hyperlock Heel - Provides a precise heel lock for quick descents and sharp turns.
Traditional Lacing System - Offers a secure, locked-in feel.
Dual-Directional Flex Grooves - Offer agility and stability on uneven terrain.
